page.title: 10 Fourways Inn, St Minver
page.content: In the days when St Minver village was owned by the{squire}the present public house at the crossroads was called the Temperance Inn. Then it became a private house .In{1962}the present owner,having retired from the R.A.F. opened it as a free house called the Fourways Inn .Six people are employed regularly. During the{summer}tourist season many more seasonal staff need to be employed .{Opening hours}are 11.am until 2.pm. It re_opens at 5.pm until 10.pm. On Fridays and Saturdays it closes at 11.pm. In the summer many holidaymakers and regulars visit the pub.The main bar serves three interconnecting rooms and there is also a{steak bar}and a{children's room {.There are two darts team . Other games include a pool table,video games, euchre and dominoes.
